message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the purpose of a telescope. A telescope is used to observe heavenly bodies such as stars, planets, galaxies, and other objects in the sky. Option (B) is incorrect because while star charts can be used to navigate the sky, they are not observed through a telescope. Option (C) is incorrect because telescopes are not used to observe animals. Option (D) is incorrect because telescopes are not used to observe bodies of water.

Option (C) is incorrect because telescopes are not typically used to observe animals. Option (D) is incorrect because telescopes are not used to observe water, as water is not an astronomical object.
